description: Storing matter as data. Simple, secure, convient.
At this point you probably have a lot of stuff. Like tons of it. So much it's hard to keep, sort, and find all you need.

/b/Applied Energistics 2/b/ (AE2) provides a solution: /b/Store stuff in data disks/b/ and /6/acess them through a single terminal/6/ with a /b/search bar/b/. These /b/Matter Energy/b/ (ME) Networks provide powerful logistics and automation solutions via the various devices that can be installed on a network.

<text>You may <aqua>view the guide in-game</aqua> by hovering over items. You also may refer to the  <underline><dark_aqua><link href="https://guide.appliedenergistics.org/1.20.1">Online Documentation</link></dark_aqua></underline> for everything you need to know about <aqua>ME Networks</aqua>. Both the in-game and online guides are identical, so pick your perfered method.</text>
The minimum you'll need for a setup is a /b/ME Drive/b/, an /b/Energy Acceptor/b/, and some /b/Storage Cells/b/. If you want to acess the storage, you'll need a /b/ME Terminal/b/.
Note that /b/Cable Subparts/b/ like /b/Terminals/b/ must be /6/mounted on a cable/6/.
Here is a free storage cell for you. Smallest size. Best for a variety of items
